channel.title: Disabling buttons below (report abuse etc) (delta)
channel.description: can anyone point me in the right direction, im trying to change/ disable the buttons (like for report abuse i want to make it so it says "Log Out" logs out directly)

item.title: Disabling buttons below (report abuse etc) (delta)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:10, topic:529317”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=648072.msg4359253#msg4359253 date=1378355052]

change the text, and look for the clickbutton id

Actually, that entire interface is handled client sided.
Search “Report Abuse” in client.java client sided.
Then find it’s clicking button ID in the client (should be near the text).
After getting the ID, search it.
Remove the case for the ID.
Then the clicking button will pop up on your server.

I am pretty sure you can change it server-sided from some frames.

No packet or anything is sent from the client to the server when the client handles the buttons… (On most if not all 317s)

Had to edit out client sided quick chat.

I have the packet debugger telling me to handle the packet.

In 317 its packet 75 (or 175? or something like that?).

Hm. Nothing sends for me when I click client sided buttons. They act like the buttons…
[/quote]
I’m pretty sure PI doesn’t print out if the packet is handled or not.[/quote]

Implying my pi is shit like everyone elses.
We should stop talking no this thread though.

Read full topic
